reviews.review_text:
It took a long walk for us to reach this place, but we could not feel more rewarded!
The restaurant has amazing views, some fresh sea breeze and nice atmosphere hearing the palm trees leaves moving with the wind.
The menu is very interesting. We went for fish cutlets for starters, and the beef tongue, really nice. And the amazing prawns curry rice, amazing. The prices are good and the service very nice and kind. They have some good beers too. White Owl, yeah! And some liquors on the menu too.
It goes straigh to our list of favourite restaurants in Goa!

White house has always been the regular spot for us for a few years now, and it's been gaining popularity like crazy. Its got beautiful views and simple food. Some of the best potato fries I've had in Goa.

Going to White House is like going home. And by home I mean a truly Goan home. The proprietors are warm and welcoming and the place has got a comfortable feel to it. It has a  beautiful, unobstructed sea view and the breeze that comes with it. It can be best described as a much needed low key food haven away from the crowded city.

The food at White House is authentically home made and every morsel bursts with flavour. The menu is not extensive and every dish that leaves the kitchen is spot on. Trust me, I've tasted everything on the menu. My all time favorites include the fried calvam, the beef croquettes, the fish cutlets, the boiled goan chorizo and the chicken cafreal. As for the cost, it is very affordable.

If you're looking for a hearty meal, good view, excellent ambiance music and a quiet evening this is the place for you.
